data.description: Company Information PACCAR is a Fortune 500 company recognized as a global leader in the commercial vehicle, financial, and customer service fields with internationally recognized brands such as Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF trucks. PACCAR is a global technology leader in the design, manufacture and customer support of high-quality light-, medium- and heavy-duty trucks under the Kenworth, Peterbilt, and DAF nameplates. PACCAR designs and manufactures advanced diesel engines and also provides customized financial services, information technology, and truck parts related to its principal business. We’re investing in sustainability for the long haul. We are a purpose-led, values-driven company that believes the work we do today makes a difference tomorrow. Whether you are starting out your career or continuing to build upon one, PACCAR provides opportunities for both! Join a community of professionals that is helping build the best in industry products and services that keep our communities running! Requisition Summary PACCAR is searching for talented individuals to join our PACCAR Financial Team for 2026! The selected candidate will work with our team in Bellevue, WA. We are pleased you are seeking an internship with PACCAR and wish you the best of luck! Internships include unique learning opportunities such as: Learn first-hand from the industry’s top professionals Work directly with Senior Managers and Directors Develop mentoring relationships with experienced professionals Gain valuable hands-on experience The Intern will be a part of the PACCAR Financial Corp (PFC) Data and Analytics Team, supporting Credit, Sales, and Marketing functions. The intern will gain exposure and hands on experience in managing complex data sets from a variety of sources, developing analytic models, utilizing AI and associated Machine Learning capabilities, and presenting results to PFC’s senior leadership. Internships are scheduled to begin in early to mid-May/June 2026Job Functions / Responsibilities Participate in project-based work with our PFC Data and Analytics team. Complete assigned projects with Analytics Director and manager to include: Assisting in the development of analytic models and validation of supporting data Supporting integration of AI technologies into business processes Creating KPI reporting dashboards using Tableau Assisting with month-end and ad hoc reporting on credit transactions and portfolio quality Developing Methods to evaluate return on investment for the new analytics models. Enhance access to data from new/recently implemented business systems. Effectively communicate analytic results that demonstrate business impacts. Skills / Competencies Currently pursuing a degree in Analytics, Engineering, Computer Science, Statistics, Business, Finance, or other related field Proficient in Microsoft Office; capable of advanced functions in MS Excel. Exposure and basic-level skills with technologies used by the team: SQL Server and Relational Databases MS Access Analytic programming languages (e.g., R, Python, etc.) Excellent verbal and written communication skills Resourceful and a self-starter Strong professionalism Analytical and Critical thinking Education Bachelor's Degree in Progress in junior or senior standing preferred Intern Benefits As a U.S. PACCAR intern, you have a full range of benefit options including: Competitive salary and 401k with up to a 5% company match Medical, dental, and vision plans for you and your family Flexible spending accounts (FSA) and health savings account (HSA) EAP services: including wellness plans, estate planning, financial counseling, and more Global Fortune 500 company with a wide array of growth, training, and development opportunities Work alongside experienced goal-oriented colleagues recognized as experts in their field Additional Job Board Information At PACCAR, we value talent and promote growth and development. We carefully consider numerous compensation factors, including your education, training, or experience. The salary range for internship positions is $25 an hour for undergraduate students and $30 an hour for graduate students. Additionally, this role is eligible for a range of benefit options listed above. If you would like more information about what makes PACCAR an excellent place to work, please visit the PACCAR Career Site. PACCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veteran/Disability.
